sen.j: 今日、日本で行われている中国茶の淹れ方は、福建・広東で発祥した形式である「工夫茶（功夫茶）」である。
sen.e: The way of pouring Chinese tea in Japan in current days is the form called "kufu cha (gubu cha)" that originated from Canton, Fujian Province.

sen.j: 中国においては、漢の時代には飲茶の習慣が根付いていたと考えられているが、嗜好品として広まったために、「道」としての茶道はおこらなかった。
sen.e: It is believed that the tea drinking custom settled in the ages of Han, but since it spread as a drink to just enjoy its taste, sado did not develop as "the way."

sen.j: そのため、中国で単に「茶道」と言う場合は「日本の茶道」をさす。
sen.e: As a result, when it is simply called "sado" in China, it points to the "Japanese sado."

sen.e: The tuning of Shamisen used in this song was the unique "six down" and brought out special atmosphere with this tune, while the passage of music is solid, tegoto is long, and the koto player of Kengyo YAEZAKI is done skillfully as a symphony, and is often performed in symphonies even now.
